definition: gas/air/smell/weather/to make angry/to annoy/to get angry/vital energy/qi
to defeat/to damage/to lose (to an opponent)/to fail/to wither
bad/spoiled/broken/to break down/(suffix) to the utmost

sentences.english: The breeze copies to connect Lian to use to pester a blade earthquake to open nearby one flower petal and flustered and frustratedly says.
sentences.chinese: 风影连帘用气刃震开身边一片花瓣，气急败坏的说道。

sentences.english: He flared up and sputtered out the story.
sentences.chinese: 他勃然大怒，气急败坏地说出事实的真相。

sentences.english: Tied to a corner of the cellar, such as the ants when Mr Zhang is flustered.
sentences.chinese: 被绑在地窖一角如百蚁闹心的张志强气急败坏。

sentences.english: Still others were on radios calling for air support.
sentences.chinese: 还有人气急败坏地用无线电呼叫空中支援。

sentences.english: Again and again the Gnat stung the Lion, who now was roaring terribly.
sentences.chinese: 在蚊子一次又一次的挑衅下，狮子气急败坏地咆哮着。

sentences.english: His subordinates had never seen the count so gloomy and irascible.
sentences.chinese: 近侍们从未见过伯爵如此阴郁和气急败坏。

sentences.english: "Damn you, " he sputtered. "Could you not have told me sooner?
sentences.chinese: “他气急败坏地说”你为什么不早点告诉我？

sentences.english: The hunter cried out angrily that the fox had outwitted him.
sentences.chinese: 猎人以为上了狐狸的当，便气急败坏地大叫起来。

definition: stamp with fury/fly into a rage
unable to restrain one's anger (idiom); in a towering rage
to fly into a rage out of humiliation/to be ashamed into anger (idiom)
gnashing one's teeth (idiom); displaying extreme anger/fuming with rage between gritted teeth
variant of 憤憤|愤愤[fen4 fen4]
to stomp or hop about (in anxiety, anger etc)/to dance on one's feet/hopping mad (anxious, etc)
